items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Japan
Singapore authorities file additional charges in server fraud case
items.summary:
- Authorities in Singapore filed additional charges against three men in a server fraud case on Mar. 6.
- The case involves 22 individuals and firms over false claims about Nvidia chips; U.S. export violations remain unclear.
- Suspects Aaron Woon and Alan Wei face charges for defrauding Super Micro and making false statements about Dell servers.
- Servers were reportedly sent to Malaysia, raising legal scrutiny, and Li Ming also appeared in court.
- 42 devices have been seized for forensic analysis, tracking financial transactions with global agencies' cooperation.

items.title: Singapore authorities files additional charges in server fraud case
items.summary:
- Singapore authorities filed additional charges against three men in a server fraud case.
- The case involves allegations of defrauding Super Micro and making false statements about Dell servers.
- Investigators are looking into 22 individuals and firms over false claims regarding Nvidia chips, with potential US export violations under scrutiny.
- Legal actions stem from servers allegedly sent to Malaysia.
- Forensic analysis has begun on 42 seized devices, with international cooperation on financial transactions.

items.title: Alibaba stock jumps 7.5% after AI model announcement
items.summary:
- Alibaba Group's stock rose by 7.5% on Mar. 6, marking the largest increase in nearly two weeks.
- This surge followed the announcement of its open-source AI model, QwQ-32B, which was introduced the same day.
- The QwQ-32B model competes with DeepSeek’s R1 while using only 5% of the data parameters, enhancing efficiency.
- The stock rise is attributed to increased investor confidence and Alibaba's recent recovery from regulatory issues.
- Alibaba's market value has increased by approximately US$135 billion this year.

items.title: Ex-SoftBank exec’s son raises $150m for Indian tech startups
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Rohan Misra, son of former SoftBank Vision Fund chief Rajeev Misra, launches Gravity Holdings fund.
- The fund has raised $150 million, mainly from undisclosed domestic family offices and senior executives.
- Gravity Holdings will focus on growth-stage investments in Indian tech startups.
- More details about the fund's future plans are anticipated soon.

items.title: EV startup Canoo CEO to buy assets after bankruptcy
items.summary:
- CEO Anthony Aquila proposed to buy nearly all assets of Canoo after its Chapter 7 bankruptcy filing.
- He offered US$4 million in cash for the acquisition through WHS Energy Solutions, Inc.
- The deal would eliminate over US$11 million in debt owed to a financial firm controlled by Aquila.
- Other bidders have until Mar. 28 to submit competing offers for the assets.

items.title: YouTube launches ad-free video streaming for $7.99 per month
items.summary:
- YouTube has launched a subscription service called "Premium Lite" for $7.99 per month.
- The Premium Lite plan offers an ad-free experience on most videos, excluding ad-free music access.
- This plan differs from current options: the $13.99 Premium plan for ad-free videos and music, and the $10.99 Music Premium plan focusing solely on ad-free music videos.

items.title: Chipmaker Marvell Technology sees $1.9b revenue forecast
items.summary:
- Marvell Technology projected Q1 revenue of $1.88 billion, slightly above estimates of $1.87 billion.
- Shares fell by 15% in after-hours trading on Mar. 5 due to concerns over AI growth.
- Data center revenues rose 78% year-on-year in Q4, reaching $1.37 billion, driven by demand for AI chips.
- In December 2024, Marvell signed a five-year agreement with Amazon for custom AI chips.

items.title: Why Shopee is key to SeaMoney’s success
items.summary:
- Shopee overtook Lazada to become Southeast Asia’s largest ecommerce platform, maintaining its lead into 2024.
- Shopee recorded positive annual adjusted earnings for the first time in 2024, with a projected gross merchandise value increase of 20%.
- In Q4 2024, nearly half of SPX Express deliveries in Asia were completed within two days.
- The article discusses Sea Group’s second profitable year, largely fueled by Shopee’s growth and adjacent lending business.

items.title: Bolt claims 540% surge in driver-partners across Malaysia
items.summary:
- Bolt experienced a 540% growth in driver-partners and a 280% increase in registered passengers within three months of launching in Malaysia.
- The platform's low 15% commission rate enhances drivers' earnings, contributing to over 22.8 million ringgit (US$5.15 million) in driver revenue.
- Bolt introduced activation bonuses and daily campaigns to support driver engagement, alongside the launch of Bolt Executive for premium ride services.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Japan
Computer parts maker Logitech plans $2b share buyback
Amazon Prime Video adds AI dubbing for English, Spanish
items.summary:
- Amazon Prime Video launches AI-aided dubbing for select movies and series starting **Mar. 5, 2025**.
- Initially supports **English and Spanish** for **12 titles** lacking dubbing options.
- Aims to enhance global accessibility for content across its platform with over **200 million customers** worldwide.
- Part of a broader trend of media companies utilizing AI to improve user experience.

items.title: Peak XV investor departs after 9 years
items.author: Shraeyansh Thakur
items.summary:
- Shraeyansh Thakur leaves Peak XV Partners after over nine years.
- He announced his decision on LinkedIn to pursue an entrepreneurial venture.
- Thakur joined Peak XV in 2015 and worked with startups like Meesho, CARS24, and Unacademy.
- He previously held roles at RBS and Standard Chartered.

items.title: WeChat mini-game advertising surges 113%: report
items.summary:
- WeChat mini-game advertising sector experienced a 113% year-over-year growth in 2024.
- Over 18,400 mini-games launched ads from January to October 2024, up from 8,600 in the same period of 2023.
- Total creatives produced reached 3.7 million between January and October 2024, doubling from 1.8 million in 2023.
- Full-year estimates suggest the total number of creatives could reach 4.3 million.
- The report highlights the need for high-quality creative optimization as market competition increases.

items.title: Ola Group, Lenovo to build India’s largest supercomputer
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Krutrim, an AI company under Ola Group, is partnering with Lenovo to develop India’s largest supercomputer.
- The announcement was made at Lenovo TechWorld India 2025.
- Ola Group's chief investment officer Navendu Agarwal stated the supercomputer will utilize Krutrim’s cloud capabilities and AI models.
- Krutrim is training its “Krutrim 3” model on 700 billion parameters, backed by Ola’s US$230 million investment, with plans for US$1 billion next year.
- As part of the IndiaAI Mission, Lenovo aims to enhance manufacturing and R&D in India, producing all AI-powered PCs locally by 2028 and launching India-made AI servers starting April 1.

items.title: GenAI platform Phot.AI bags $2.7m seed funding
items.author: Venus Dhuria, Aneesh Rayancha, Akshit Raja
items.summary:
- Phot.AI, an AI-driven creative automation platform based in India, has raised $2.7 million in seed funding.
- The funding round was led by Info Edge Ventures, with participation from Together Fund, AC Ventures, and over 50 angel investors.
- Funds will be used for team expansion, R&D, and launching a new copilot feature.
- Founded in 2023, Phot.AI helps ecommerce businesses automate design tasks such as product listings and ads.
- The platform has over 3 million global sign-ups and is used by more than 25 businesses for workflow automation.
- Phot.AI has participated in the AWS Generative AI Accelerator and the JioGenNext program for scaling AI solutions in ecommerce.

items.title: UAE’s Smiles, Tencent Cloud partner for digital commerce
items.summary:
- Smiles and Tencent Cloud partner to enhance digital commerce in the UAE.
- Partnership announced at the Mobile World Congress 2025 in Barcelona.
- Smiles will implement Tencent Cloud’s Super App as a Service solution, enabling businesses to have 'mini apps' in the Smiles platform, similar to WeChat.
- The integration aims to provide consumers with more services and rewards on a single app.

items.title: US court dismisses Intel shareholder suit over layoffs
items.summary:
- A US district court dismissed a shareholder lawsuit against Intel on Mar. 4.
- The suit claimed Intel hid problems in its foundry business, leading to job cuts and suspended dividends.
- The case followed Intel's reported US$7 billion operating loss for fiscal 2023, revealed in April 2024.

items.title: Google tests AI-powered search with summarized results
Tata Electronics partners with Himax, PSMC on display AI chips
items.summary:
- Tata Electronics signs an MoU with Taiwan's Himax and PSMC for semiconductor development.
- The partnership focuses on display semiconductors for TVs, smartphones, and monitors, as well as AI sensing chips.
- This initiative aims to enhance supply chain resilience and meet domestic and global demands.
- Tata's first semiconductor plant in Dholera is set for September 2024, with design support from PSMC.
- Himax specializes in fabless display semiconductors; PSMC produces over 2.1 million wafers annually in Taiwan.

items.title: Alibaba-backed robotics firm completes $69m series A
items.summary:
- LimX Dynamics raised a total of 500 million yuan (US$69.02 million) in a series A+ financing round.
- Funding came from industrial players and financial institutions, including Alibaba Group.
- The company showcased a full-size humanoid robot in December 2024 capable of basic movements, with a 360° rotating hip joint for flexibility.
- LimX Dynamics is focused on developing both bipedal and quadruped robotic systems.

items.title: Israeli fintech firm Grain bags $33m series A
items.summary:
- Grain has raised US$33 million in a series A funding round led by Bain Capital Ventures.
- Total investment in Grain now exceeds US$50 million, including an US$18 million seed round in 2022.
- Founded in 2022, Grain specializes in foreign exchange (FX) optimization using AI-driven automation for businesses in the global commerce sector valued at US$150 trillion.

items.title: Electronic components maker Jabil to invest $125m in India
items.summary:
- Jabil will invest approximately US$125 million to establish a silicon photonics manufacturing plant in Gujarat.
- The announcement was made during the IESA Vision Summit in Gandhinagar, with a memorandum of understanding (MoU) signed with the Gujarat government.
- The plant is expected to be operational by year-end and will produce components for telecom, AI, and 5G.

items.title: Israeli AI sales platform hits $300m revenue run rate
items.summary:
- Gong, an Israeli sales intelligence platform, has surpassed a US$300 million annual revenue run rate.
- The growth is attributed to the adoption of AI-powered solutions, with revenue increasing by 25%-30% annually.
- The company counts four Fortune 10 firms among its customers and has seen a doubling of seven-figure contracts in the past year.
- Gong raised US$250 million in 2021, valuing the company at US$7.2 billion, and has not sought further investments since, ensuring financial stability.

items.title: Oyo sets $126.5m profit for FY26 after G6 Hospitality deal
items.summary:
- Oyo projects a profit of 1,100 crore rupee (US$126.51 million) for FY26, boosted by the acquisition of G6 Hospitality.
- G6 Hospitality is expected to contribute 630 crore rupee (US$72.46 million) to Oyo's EBITDA, raising it to 2,000 crore rupee (US$230.02 million).
- Oyo reported a profit of 229 crore rupee (US$26.34 million) for FY24 and forecasts earnings of 700 crore rupee (US$80.51 million) for FY25.
- In Q3 FY25, Oyo's net profit increased sixfold to 166 crore rupee (US$19.09 million) with a revenue rise of 31% year-on-year to 1,695 crore rupee (US$194.95 million).
- Oyo faces pressure from creditors regarding its IPO and loan repayments of US$383 million, with a deadline for public listing set for October 2025.

items.title: SK Telecom, Schneider Electric partner on AI data centers
items.summary:
- SK Telecom partners with Schneider Electric for AI data center solutions in South Korea.
- The agreement focuses on developing mechanical, electrical, and plumbing (MEP) systems for hyperscale data centers.
- SK Telecom aims to leverage its AI data center experience alongside Schneider Electric's expertise in power and cooling management systems.

items.title: Tesla signs lease deal for first showroom in India
items.summary:
- Tesla has signed a lease for its first showroom in India, located in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex.
- The showroom is 4,003 square feet, with the first-year rent at 3.87 crore rupees (US$443,400).
- The lease, registered last week, is a deal between Tesla India Motors & Energy and Univco Properties LLP, spanning five years with a 5% annual rent increase.

items.title: Trump’s trade policies threaten Israel’s tech exports
items.summary:
- US trade policies under Trump raise concerns for Israel’s economy, especially in export sector.
- Proposed tariffs could impact key goods and industries vital to Israel’s economic growth.
- In 2024, Israel exported US$14.2 billion in goods to the US, a 4.5% increase from the previous year.
- Business services topped exports, exceeding US$20 billion in 2021, accounting for 48% of global business services exports.
- Potential US tariffs pose risks, recalling previous metal tariffs from Trump’s first term.
- Concerns focus on critical industries like semiconductors and pharmaceuticals, with US$8.5 billion in annual exports.

items.title: South Korea’s KG Mobility unveils first electric pickup truck
items.summary:
- KG Mobility has unveiled the Musso EV, South Korea's first electric pickup truck.
- Launch event took place on Mar. 5 at the company's headquarters in Pyeongtaek, attended by executives from BYD.
- The Musso EV features an 80.6-kWh lithium iron phosphate battery with a range of 400 km.
- It has a payload capacity of 500 kg and spacious seating for families.
- Available in two trim options: Black Edge (50.5 million won / US$34,674) and base MX (48 million won / US$33,409), both eligible for government subsidies.

items.title: China pilots M&A loan reforms to boost tech growth
items.summary:
- China’s financial regulator is launching a pilot program to ease M&A loan rules for tech firms.
- The program increases the loan proportion for M&A transactions to 80% from 60%.
- Maximum loan term extended to 10 years, up from 7 years.
- The pilot will be implemented in 18 cities, including Beijing and Shanghai, to support tech sector growth.

items.title: India to develop national AI model, prime minister says
items.summary:
- Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced plans to create a national large language model (LLM) for AI research on Mar. 5, 2025.
- The Indian government allocated US$57.5 million for AI-driven education and research initiatives.
- This aligns with the IndiaAI mission, previously discussed by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in January.
- The government approved the acquisition of 18,693 graphics processing units (GPUs) for machine learning tools.
- Startups, researchers, and entrepreneurs are invited to develop foundational AI models for Indian datasets.

items.title: Kakao Bank nominates Yun Ho-young for fifth term as CEO
items.summary:
- Kakao Bank CEO Yun Ho-young nominated for a fifth term as CEO.
- The nomination was confirmed via a regulatory filing on March 4.
- Shareholders' meeting scheduled for March 26 to approve reappointment.
- Yun has been with Kakao Bank since its launch in 2017 and previously served as vice president of Kakao Corporation.
- If approved, his new two-year term will start after the current term ends on March 28.

items.title: Indian supply chain startup Zetwerk bags $5m
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based B2B manufacturing startup Zetwerk has raised US$5 million in a funding round co-led by Arc Investments and Oriental Biotech Limited.
- The company issued 9,93,721 series F3 compulsorily convertible preference shares (CCPS) priced at US$4.98 each.
- Arc Investments and Oriental Biotech each contributed US$1.15 million, with Stargazer Fund-I investing US$575,205, and additional funds from angel investors.
- This funding round is reportedly ongoing with potential for further capital to be raised soon.

items.title: Samsung considers US battery plant despite policy changes
items.summary:
- Samsung SDI Co. is exploring the possibility of building a new battery production facility in the US.
- CEO Joo Sun Choi highlighted the need for caution due to a decline in demand for electric vehicles (EVs) this year compared to last.
- The potential US plant is seen as part of Samsung SDI's long-term growth strategy despite current challenges and changes in US policies.

items.title: Malaysian proptech firm LiveIn acquires RedDoorz’s rental brand
items.summary:
- Malaysia-based proptech firm LiveIn acquires KoolKost, a long-term accommodation brand in Indonesia owned by RedDoorz.
- The acquisition encompasses 27 properties across six cities.
- KoolKost, founded in 2020, caters to long-term travelers, students, and workers with affordable accommodations offering amenities such as Wi-Fi, cleaning services, and drinking water.
- Post-acquisition, KoolKost will function as a sub-brand of LiveIn Indonesia, integrating its properties into LiveIn’s categories: LiveIn Intro, Select, and Signature.
- This acquisition responds to Indonesia's projected urbanization, with 66.6% of the population expected to reside in cities by 2035, driving demand for flexible and affordable housing.

items.title: TSMC won’t make advanced chips in US next year, minister says
items.author: Kuo Jyh-huei
items.summary:
- TSMC's most advanced chip technologies (2nm and 1.6nm) will not be produced in the US until at least 2026.
- Taiwan’s Economics Minister, Kuo Jyh-huei, confirmed this during a legislative session on March 4.
- Kuo stated that it is impossible for these processes to be introduced at TSMC’s US facilities next year.

items.title: SoftBank-backed cybersecurity CEO quits in funding battle
items.summary:
- Eric Gan has resigned as CEO of Cybereason due to boardroom conflicts and financial struggles.
- The cybersecurity startup is dealing with worsening funding issues and internal disputes.
- Gan cited irreconcilable differences with the board, following a lawsuit against investors Liberty Strategic Capital and SoftBank's Vision Fund, who are accused of blocking funding.
- Cybereason's valuation has dropped dramatically from US$5 billion in 2021 to between US$300 million and US$400 million as of 2023.
- Financial troubles, workforce cuts, and IPO delays threaten the company's viability, with a risk of bankruptcy.
- SoftBank provided a US$100 million lifeline in April 2023, but internal disputes continue to impede funding.
- The company plans to merge with Trustwave, but instability poses uncertainty for the deal.
- Gan intends to pursue legal action against the major investors, leaving the company’s future uncertain.

items.title: Sweden’s Areim raises $481m for sustainable data centers
items.summary:
- Swedish fund manager Areim raised €450 million (US$481 million) for sustainable data center development.
- The funding announcement took place on March 5.
- The initiative aims to reduce the environmental impact of data centers via its subsidiary, EcoDataCenter.
- Areim has not disclosed the identities of the international investors involved.
- EcoDataCenter focuses on minimizing emissions and optimizing energy efficiency using renewable energy and advanced technologies.
- The first data center operated by EcoDataCenter was launched in Falun, southern Sweden, in 2019.

items.title: Indian HR tech firm Darwinbox secures $140m in funding
items.summary:
- Hyderabad-based HR tech startup Darwinbox has raised US$140 million in a funding round co-led by Partners Group and KKR.
- The funding will support Darwinbox’s international expansion and technological enhancements.
- 60% of Darwinbox’s business currently originates from global markets, with international revenue increasing fivefold recently.
- Founded in 2015, Darwinbox provides a cloud-based HR management platform featuring recruitment, payroll, performance management, and employee engagement.
- Notable clients include Starbucks, Nivea, AXA, and WeWork.

items.title: Samsung union approves 5.1% wage increase
items.summary:
- The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) approved a 5.1% wage increase for its members in 2025.
- The agreement was reached last month and required ratification by union members.
- The NSEU represents about 36,000 employees, approximately 30% of Samsung’s workforce in South Korea.
- Samsung will also provide employees with points for company product purchases and distribute 30 shares of company stock.

items.title: Discover your inner princess this International Women’s Day [Quiz]
items.summary:
- The article is part of Tech in Asia’s 2025 International Women’s Day campaign to support women in tech.
- It encourages a reimagining of the traditional fairy tale princess narrative by promoting strength and resilience.
- A quiz titled *Hello Princess* allows participants to explore their inner selves and personality by deciding how to escape a tower situation.
- The quiz aims to provide a deeper self-understanding and is open to all genders.
- This year’s International Women’s Day theme is “Accelerate Action,” focusing on both outward and inward actions to improve the world.

items.title: Korean wave is sweeping into Japan’s startup ecosystem
items.summary:
[The Korean wave is influencing Japan's startup ecosystem by introducing cultural trends and investment opportunities.]
[Japanese startups are increasingly collaborating with South Korean companies for innovation and market expansion.]
[The presence of K-pop and Korean entertainment is fostering interest among Japanese consumers, creating new business avenues.]

items.title: Foxconn’s first two month revenue jumps 25%
items.summary:
- Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. (Foxconn) reported a 25% revenue increase for January and February 2025, reaching NT$1.1 trillion (US$33.5 billion).
- This improvement is from an 11% growth in the same period last year. Analysts expect first-quarter revenue to reach NT$1.6 trillion (US$48.78 billion), a 22% year-on-year rise.
- Growth is attributed to strong demand for AI computing infrastructure, particularly Nvidia’s Blackwell-powered servers. Nvidia reported US$11 billion in revenue from this chip.
- Foxconn anticipates significant first-quarter growth as a key supplier for Nvidia AI servers and Apple products.
- Foxconn is expanding in the US, planning to manufacture AI servers in Houston in partnership with Apple later this year.

items.title: Nvidia stock drops on Nasdaq slump, China risks
items.summary:
- Nvidia's stock has contributed over 30% to the Nasdaq's decline this year.
- The stock fell below its 200-day moving average in January for the first time in over two years.
- Analysts have identified support levels at US$113, US$110, and potentially as low as US$90, with projections targeting US$107 to US$103.
- The stock's forward earnings multiple is now 25, the lowest in over a year.
- Market uncertainty affects major tech stocks; Nasdaq 100 is nearing correction territory.
- Tariffs and AI-related export restrictions, especially related to China, add to the pressure on Nvidia.
- Decreasing momentum and investor caution raise concerns, with some experts suggesting a long-term peak may have been reached.

items.title: AI dominates Wall Street as firms push monetization, IPOs
items.summary:
- Mentions of AI in Wall Street earnings calls reached a record high, with 50% of S&P 500 companies discussing AI, compared to 30% earlier in 2024.
- Only 6% of US companies actively use AI, with another 10% planning to adopt it.
- Strongest AI adoption is seen in tech, finance, and professional services, while sectors like transportation and construction are lagging.
- On Mar. 5, CoreWeave filed for an IPO after a 730% revenue increase to $1.9 billion in 2024, despite a loss of $863 million.
- CoreWeave's IPO may catalyze the 2025 IPO market.
- Companies are emphasizing AI monetization; Monday.com’s pay-per-minute AI model boosted its stock by 30%, while Fiverr and Kaltura’s launches saw stock declines.
- Investors are shifting focus to measurable financial impacts of AI in 2025.

items.title: UK regulator approves chip design software firm’s $35b deal
items.summary:
- The UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has approved Synopsys’ US$35 billion acquisition of Ansys.
- Initial concerns about the deal potentially hindering innovation and raising prices were addressed, leading to no in-depth investigation.
- Synopsys, a chip design tool provider, announced the acquisition deal in January; Ansys develops software used in various industries.

items.title: SEA’s AI players target end users as DeepSeek stifles LLMs
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese startup, has raised competition in the AI sector, affecting even established players like OpenAI.
- In January, DeepSeek released a reasoning model for free, prompting OpenAI to integrate similar features into its free ChatGPT version.
- Southeast Asian startups may need to build on existing LLMs rather than competing with foundational models, focusing on practical use cases for agentic AI.
- Users prioritize application functionality over the underlying models, as seen with GoTo's migration from Google Cloud to Alibaba Cloud.
- Advanced LLMs have made language comprehension issues less significant, suggesting that the justification for developing regional LLMs may need further evaluation.

items.title: A cheat sheet of M&As in Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- Since 2006, Tech in Asia has tracked M&A activity in Southeast Asia.
- The article compiles trends and milestones in the region's M&A landscape.
- Highlights the average and median deal sizes and variations in deal structures.
- Discusses the most active M&A sectors and identifies top acquirers in the region.

items.title: Leap Finance secures $100m in debt facility from HSBC
items.summary:
- Leap Finance secured a US$100 million debt facility from HSBC under its ASEAN Growth Fund.
- The funding aims to assist more Indian students in pursuing postgraduate education abroad.
- Leap Finance has provided over US$250 million in education loans to more than 5,000 students.
- The company focuses on a student’s future earning potential for its collateral-free, USD-denominated loans.
- Plans to expand services across the United States and improve its presence in India.
- This follows a successful US$65 million series E equity round led by Apis Partners, increasing cumulative funding to over US$400 million since 2019.
